events.title: Battle of Culloden
events.description: The last pitched battle fought on British soil, where the British government army defeated the Jacobite forces of Charles Edward Stuart.
events.significance: Marked the end of the Jacobite uprising and significantly altered Scottish culture and clan structures.

events.title: First Successful Parachute Descent
events.description: Andr√©-Jacques Garnerin made the first successful parachute jump, descending from a hot air balloon at an altitude of 3,000 feet over Paris.
events.significance: Pioneered the use of parachutes, which later had important applications in aviation and military operations.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis Hotline Established
events.description: The United States and the Soviet Union agreed to establish a direct communication link, known as the 'Hotline', to prevent nuclear conflicts.
events.significance: Reduced the risk of accidental nuclear war by enabling direct communication between superpowers.

events.title: Vietnam War Ends with Fall of Saigon
events.description: Though the official fall of Saigon occurred on April 30, events leading to the conclusion of the Vietnam War culminated around this period with the complete withdrawal of U.S. forces and North Vietnamese consolidation.
events.significance: Marked the end of a significant and controversial conflict impacting global politics and U.S. foreign policy.

events.title: First Harry Potter Book Published in the U.S.
events.description: J.K. Rowling's 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' was published in the United States as 'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone'.
events.significance: Initiated a worldwide cultural phenomenon and a major influence on children's literature.
